comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Reversed, the photo appears to say "Zeisler." Probably en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fannie_Bloomfield_Zeisler It's also dated 2/6/25, so appears to be another one mysteriously out of sequence.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fannie_Bloomfield_Zeisler certainly looks as though it could be the same person. Her last concert was in Feb 1925, according to the Wikipedia article.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: rjones0856 & swanq: This does appear to be Fannie Bloomfield-Zeisler. There are also two other photographs of Bloomfield-Zeisler in the Bain Collection from the same photo shoot here and here. Thanks for working out her identity. We will update the record to reflect this information.

comment.author: 8685077@N07
comment._content: Photo is correct and not reversed: Highest note on treble end of the piano is C8, as shown in this image.
